QuestionJSON.Question: Delhi and their friends are brainstorming for a start-up. They quickly notice that the process of assessing the potential of a business idea is repetitive and could be automated. Delhi thinks of a procedure in which an idea is input and the output indicates whether it is a good idea or not based on previous data. Which of the following code best represents this procedure?
QuestionJSON.Answer1:
procedure evaluateBusinessIdea(number averageProfit, number startupCosts)
if averageProfit > startupCosts
print 'Good Idea'
else
print 'Bad Idea'
end
end
QuestionJSON.Answer2:
procedure evaluateBusinessIdea(data BusinessIdea)
if BusinessIdea.averageProfit > BusinessIdea.startupCosts
print 'Good Idea'
else
print 'Bad Idea'
end
end
QuestionJSON.Answer3:
procedure evaluateBusinessIdea(data BusinessIdea)
boolean ideaValuation
if (BusinessIdea.averageProfit > BusinessIdea.startupCosts)
ideaValuation = false
else
ideaValuation = true
end
print ideaValuation
end
QuestionJSON.Answer4:
procedure evaluateBusinessIdea()
number averageProfit = getInput('Enter average profit: ')
number startupCosts = getInput('Enter startup costs: ')
if averageProfit > startupCosts
print 'Good Idea'
else
print 'Bad Idea'
end
end
QuestionJSON.Explanation: The most efficient procedure to evaluate a business idea would use a Business Idea object as a parameter. This object could include all the necessary data fields like averageProfit, startupCosts, marketSize, etc., allowing the procedure to be easily reused for other ideas.
